results.title: Van Meegeren's faked Vermeers (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the scientific methods used to prove Van Meegeren’s contention that he was the painter of works of art which had previously been accepted as genuine Vermeers by museums and art critics. Scientific instruments employeed include radio and X-ray appoaratus; also a chemical analysis of the materials used was taken. The film explains the reason for Van Meegerens faking of Vermeers works, and mentions his means of disposing of the pictures and the sentence passed on him. Adapted from Prof. P.B. Coreman’s book “Van Meegeren’s faked Vermeers and De Hooghs”.

results.title: Valleys and people
results.creator_credit: Douglas M. Robinson and Summit Film Productions
results.brief_description: A story of the accomplishments of Ontario’s Conservation authorities Branch, Department of Energy and Resources Management in Canada. Looks at how a conservation authority works and emphasises the need to retain the balance of nature.

results.title: Usutu
results.creator_credit: Stephen Peet, Raymond Spottiswoode, Courtaulds and Film Centre
results.brief_description: Describes a large afforestation project in Swaziland, which involved the planting of 50 million trees and the construction of a specially designed pulp mill. With the forest grew a new town, with schools, clinics and other social amenities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Peet, Raymond Spottiswoode, Courtaulds and Film Centre

results.title: Using small equipment in movement education (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glenn Kirchner and Burbank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Movement education”
Illustrates a variety of equipment including hoops, beanbags, and individual ropes that can be used in movement education. Shows where and how to use the equipment. Quality and variety of movement, partner work and a card system for movement education are discussed.

results.title: Using large apparatus in movement education (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glenn Kirchner and Burbank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Movement education”
This film shows how the use of different types of large apparatus can extend and challenge children’s creative and physical abilities. It also shows how to combine the use of small and large equipment.

results.title: Theme development in movement education (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glenn Kirchner and Burbank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Movement Education”.
Begins with a brief explanation of how to plan a short theme in a progressive and systematic way. In the second part, an extended theme of matching shapes is developed with a fourth grade class through a series of nine lessons. Shows excellent use of small and large equipment

results.title: Urban sprawl
results.brief_description: Shows the characteristic pattern of recent urban growth throughout the United States. Discusses the problems created by urban sprawl, explains the necessity for planning future development, and describes the factors that must be considered to make the best use of land space and to meet the total needs of people.

results.title: Urban Challenge
results.brief_description: Over-crowding and squalid living conditions have reached a crisis point in major cities in Third World Countries. This film examines the way in which governments and overseas aid agencies are meeting the challenge to improve living conditions for the cities’ poorer inhabitants.
